name: cloudflared

options.description: Filepath at which to read/write the tunnel credentials [$TUNNEL_CRED_FILE]
Cloudflare Edge region to connect to. Omit or set to empty to connect to the global region. [$TUNNEL_REGION]
Cloudflare Edge ip address version to connect with. {4, 6, auto} (default: "4") [$TUNNEL_EDGE_IP_VERSION]
When given creates an experimental post-quantum secure tunnel (default: false) [$TUNNEL_POST_QUANTUM]
Overwrites existing DNS records with this hostname (default: false) [$TUNNEL_FORCE_PROVISIONING_DNS]
show help (default: false)
Print the version (default: false)

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.description: Update the agent if a new version exists
subcommands.usage: cloudflared update [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: specify if you wish to update to the latest beta version (default: false)
specify a version you wish to upgrade or downgrade to
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Print the version
subcommands.usage: cloudflared version [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: proxy-dns
subcommands.description: Run a DNS over HTTPS proxy server.
subcommands.usage: cloudflared proxy-dns [command options]

options.description: Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Listen address for the DNS over HTTPS proxy server. (default: "localhost") [$TUNNEL_DNS_ADDRESS]
Listen on given port for the DNS over HTTPS proxy server. (default: 53) [$TUNNEL_DNS_PORT]
Upstream endpoint URL, you can specify multiple endpoints for redundancy. (default: "https://1.1.1.1/dns-query", "https://1.0.0.1/dns-query") (accepts multiple inputs) [$TUNNEL_DNS_UPSTREAM]

bootstrap endpoint URL, you can specify multiple endpoints for redundancy. (default: "https://162.159.36.1/dns-query", "https://162.159.46.1/dns-query", "https://[2606:4700:4700::1111]/dns-query", "https://[2606:4700:4700::1001]/dns-query") (accepts multiple inputs) [$TUNNEL_DNS_BOOTSTRAP]
Maximum concurrent connections to upstream. Setting to 0 means unlimited. (default: 5) [$TUNNEL_DNS_MAX_UPSTREAM_CONNS]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: service
subcommands.description: Manages the cloudflared system service
subcommands.usage: cloudflared service command [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: access
subcommands.description: Access
subcommands.usage: cloudflared access command [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: login
subcommands.description: login <url of access application>
subcommands.usage: cloudflared access login [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: curl
subcommands.description: curl [--allow-request, -ar] <url> [<curl args>...]
subcommands.usage: cloudflared access curl allow-request will allow the curl request to continue even if the jwt is not present.

subcommands.name: token
subcommands.description: token -app=<url of access application>
subcommands.usage: cloudflared access token [command options] url of Access application

options.description: --help, -h show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: tunnel
subcommands.description: Use Cloudflare Tunnel to expose private services to the Internet or to Cloudflare connected private users.
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel command [command options]

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.
Path to the certificate generated for your origin when you run cloudflared login. [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_CERT]
Autoupdate frequency. Default is 24h0m0s. (default: 24h0m0s)
Disable periodic check for updates, restarting the server with the new version. (default: false) [$NO_AUTOUPDATE]
Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Write the application's PID to this file after first successful connection. [$TUNNEL_PIDFILE]
Connect to the local webserver at URL. (default: "http://localhost:8080") [$TUNNEL_URL]
Run Hello World Server (default: false) [$TUNNEL_HELLO_WORLD]
DEPRECATED. No longer has any effect. (default: 1m30s)
DEPRECATED. No longer has any effect. (default: 1m30s)
Path to unix socket to use instead of --url [$TUNNEL_UNIX_SOCKET]
Enables HTTP/2 origin servers. (default: false) [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_ENABLE_HTTP2]
Runs as jump host (default: false) [$TUNNEL_BASTION]
Listen address for the proxy. (default: "127.0.0.1") [$TUNNEL_PROXY_ADDRESS]
Listen port for the proxy. (default: 0) [$TUNNEL_PROXY_PORT]

Application logging level {debug, info, warn, error, fatal}. At debug level cloudflared will log request URL, method, protocol, content length, as well as, all request and response headers. This can expose sensitive information in your logs. (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_LOGLEVEL]
Transport logging level(previously called protocol logging level) {debug, info, warn, error, fatal} (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_PROTO_LOGLEVEL, $TUNNEL_TRANSPORT_LOGLEVEL]
Save application log to this file for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGFILE]
Save application log to this directory for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGDIRECTORY]
Name of trace output file, generated when cloudflared stops. [$TUNNEL_TRACE_OUTPUT]
Run a DNS over HTTPS proxy server. (default: false) [$TUNNEL_DNS]
Listen on given port for the DNS over HTTPS proxy server. (default: 53) [$TUNNEL_DNS_PORT]
Listen address for the DNS over HTTPS proxy server. (default: "localhost") [$TUNNEL_DNS_ADDRESS]
Upstream endpoint URL, you can specify multiple endpoints for redundancy. (default: "https://1.1.1.1/dns-query", "https://1.0.0.1/dns-query") (accepts multiple inputs) [$TUNNEL_DNS_UPSTREAM]
Maximum concurrent connections to upstream. Setting to 0 means unlimited. (default: 5) [$TUNNEL_DNS_MAX_UPSTREAM_CONNS]

bootstrap endpoint URL, you can specify multiple endpoints for redundancy. (default: "https://162.159.36.1/dns-query", "https://162.159.46.1/dns-query", "https://[2606:4700:4700::1111]/dns-query", "https://[2606:4700:4700::1001]/dns-query") (accepts multiple inputs) [$TUNNEL_DNS_BOOTSTRAP]
Filepath at which to read/write the tunnel credentials [$TUNNEL_CRED_FILE]
Cloudflare Edge region to connect to. Omit or set to empty to connect to the global region. [$TUNNEL_REGION]
Cloudflare Edge ip address version to connect with. {4, 6, auto} (default: "4") [$TUNNEL_EDGE_IP_VERSION]
Set a hostname on a Cloudflare zone to route traffic through this tunnel. [$TUNNEL_HOSTNAME]
The name of a (new/existing) load balancing pool to add this origin to. [$TUNNEL_LB_POOL]
Frequency to update tunnel metrics (default: 5s) [$TUNNEL_METRICS_UPDATE_FREQ]
Custom tags used to identify this tunnel, in format KEY=VALUE. Multiple tags may be specified (accepts multiple inputs) [$TUNNEL_TAG]
Maximum number of retries for connection/protocol errors. (default: 5) [$TUNNEL_RETRIES]

When cloudflared receives SIGINT/SIGTERM it will stop accepting new requests, wait for in-progress requests to terminate, then shutdown. Waiting for in-progress requests will timeout after this grace period, or when a second SIGTERM/SIGINT is received. (default: 30s) [$TUNNEL_GRACE_PERIOD]
(beta) Use cross-stream compression instead HTTP compression. 0-off, 1-low, 2-medium, >=3-high. (default: 0) [$TUNNEL_COMPRESSION_LEVEL]
Stable name to identify the tunnel. Using this flag will create, route and run a tunnel. For production usage, execute each command separately [$TUNNEL_NAME]
When given creates an experimental post-quantum secure tunnel (default: false) [$TUNNEL_POST_QUANTUM]
Overwrites existing DNS records with this hostname (default: false) [$TUNNEL_FORCE_PROVISIONING_DNS]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.description: Create a new tunnel with given name
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [tunnel command options] create [subcommand options] NAME

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.
Path to the certificate generated for your origin when you run cloudflared login. [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_CERT]
Autoupdate frequency. Default is 24h0m0s. (default: 24h0m0s)
Disable periodic check for updates, restarting the server with the new version. (default: false) [$NO_AUTOUPDATE]
Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Write the application's PID to this file after first successful connection. [$TUNNEL_PIDFILE]

Application logging level {debug, info, warn, error, fatal}. At debug level cloudflared will log request URL, method, protocol, content length, as well as, all request and response headers. This can expose sensitive information in your logs. (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_LOGLEVEL]
Transport logging level(previously called protocol logging level) {debug, info, warn, error, fatal} (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_PROTO_LOGLEVEL, $TUNNEL_TRANSPORT_LOGLEVEL]
Save application log to this file for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGFILE]
Save application log to this directory for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGDIRECTORY]
Name of trace output file, generated when cloudflared stops. [$TUNNEL_TRACE_OUTPUT]
Render output using given FORMAT. Valid options are 'json' or 'yaml'
Filepath at which to read/write the tunnel credentials [$TUNNEL_CRED_FILE]
Base64 encoded secret to set for the tunnel. The decoded secret must be at least 32 bytes long. If not specified, a random 32-byte secret will be generated. [$TUNNEL_CREATE_SECRET]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: route
subcommands.description: Define which traffic routed from Cloudflare edge to this tunnel: requests to a DNS hostname, to a Cloudflare Load Balancer, or traffic originating from Cloudflare WARP clients
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel route command [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: vnet
subcommands.description: Configure and query virtual networks to manage private IP routes with overlapping IPs.
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel vnet command [command options] [arguments...]

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.description: Add a new virtual network to which IP routes can be attached
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [--config FILEPATH] network add [flags] NAME ["comment"]

options.description: The virtual network becomes the default one for the account. This means that all operations that omit a virtual network will now implicitly be using this virtual network (i.e., the default one) such as new IP routes that are created. When this flag is not set, the virtual network will not become the default one in the account. (default: false)
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Lists the virtual networks
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [--config FILEPATH] network list [flags]

options.description: List virtual networks with the given ID
List virtual networks with the given NAME

If true, lists the virtual network that is the default one. If false, lists all non-default virtual networks for the account. If absent, all are included in the results regardless of their default status. (default: false)
If false (default), only show non-deleted virtual networks. If true, only show deleted virtual networks. (default: false)
Render output using given FORMAT. Valid options are 'json' or 'yaml'
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete a virtual network
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [--config FILEPATH] network delete VIRTUAL_NETWORK

options.description: show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.description: Update a virtual network
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [--config FILEPATH] network update [flags] VIRTUAL_NETWORK

options.description: The new name for the virtual network.
A new comment describing the purpose of the virtual network.

The virtual network becomes the default one for the account. This means that all operations that omit a virtual network will now implicitly be using this virtual network (i.e., the default one) such as new IP routes that are created. When this flag is not set, the virtual network will not become the default one in the account. (default: false)
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: run
subcommands.description: Proxy a local web server by running the given tunnel
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [tunnel command options] run [subcommand options] [TUNNEL]

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.
Path to the certificate generated for your origin when you run cloudflared login. [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_CERT]
Autoupdate frequency. Default is 24h0m0s. (default: 24h0m0s)
Disable periodic check for updates, restarting the server with the new version. (default: false) [$NO_AUTOUPDATE]
Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Write the application's PID to this file after first successful connection. [$TUNNEL_PIDFILE]

Application logging level {debug, info, warn, error, fatal}. At debug level cloudflared will log request URL, method, protocol, content length, as well as, all request and response headers. This can expose sensitive information in your logs. (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_LOGLEVEL]
Transport logging level(previously called protocol logging level) {debug, info, warn, error, fatal} (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_PROTO_LOGLEVEL, $TUNNEL_TRANSPORT_LOGLEVEL]
Save application log to this file for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGFILE]
Save application log to this directory for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGDIRECTORY]
Name of trace output file, generated when cloudflared stops. [$TUNNEL_TRACE_OUTPUT]

By default, if a tunnel is currently being run from a cloudflared, you can't simultaneously rerun it again from a second cloudflared. The --force flag lets you overwrite the previous tunnel. If you want to use a single hostname with multiple tunnels, you can do so with Cloudflare's Load Balancer product. (default: false)
Filepath at which to read/write the tunnel credentials [$TUNNEL_CRED_FILE]
Contents of the tunnel credentials JSON file to use. When provided along with credentials-file, this will take precedence. [$TUNNEL_CRED_CONTENTS]
When given creates an experimental post-quantum secure tunnel (default: false) [$TUNNEL_POST_QUANTUM]
Opt into various features that are still being developed or tested. (accepts multiple inputs)
The Tunnel token. When provided along with credentials, this will take precedence. [$TUNNEL_TOKEN]
Source address to send/receive ICMPv4 messages. If not provided cloudflared will dial a local address to determine the source IP or fallback to 0.0.0.0. [$TUNNEL_ICMPV4_SRC]
Source address and the interface name to send/receive ICMPv6 messages. If not provided cloudflared will dial a local address to determine the source IP or fallback to ::. [$TUNNEL_ICMPV6_SRC]
Connect to the local webserver at URL. (default: "http://localhost:8080") [$TUNNEL_URL]
Run Hello World Server (default: false) [$TUNNEL_HELLO_WORLD]
DEPRECATED. No longer has any effect. (default: 1m30s)
DEPRECATED. No longer has any effect. (default: 1m30s)
Path to unix socket to use instead of --url [$TUNNEL_UNIX_SOCKET]
Enables HTTP/2 origin servers. (default: false) [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_ENABLE_HTTP2]
Runs as jump host (default: false) [$TUNNEL_BASTION]
Listen address for the proxy. (default: "127.0.0.1") [$TUNNEL_PROXY_ADDRESS]
Listen port for the proxy. (default: 0) [$TUNNEL_PROXY_PORT]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List existing tunnels
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [tunnel command options] list [subcommand options]

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.
Path to the certificate generated for your origin when you run cloudflared login. [$TUNNEL_ORIGIN_CERT]
Autoupdate frequency. Default is 24h0m0s. (default: 24h0m0s)
Disable periodic check for updates, restarting the server with the new version. (default: false) [$NO_AUTOUPDATE]
Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Write the application's PID to this file after first successful connection. [$TUNNEL_PIDFILE]

Application logging level {debug, info, warn, error, fatal}. At debug level cloudflared will log request URL, method, protocol, content length, as well as, all request and response headers. This can expose sensitive information in your logs. (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_LOGLEVEL]
Transport logging level(previously called protocol logging level) {debug, info, warn, error, fatal} (default: "info") [$TUNNEL_PROTO_LOGLEVEL, $TUNNEL_TRANSPORT_LOGLEVEL]
Save application log to this file for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGFILE]
Save application log to this directory for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGDIRECTORY]
Name of trace output file, generated when cloudflared stops. [$TUNNEL_TRACE_OUTPUT]
Render output using given FORMAT. Valid options are 'json' or 'yaml'
Include deleted tunnels in the list (default: false)
List tunnels with the given NAME
List tunnels that start with the give NAME prefix
List tunnels whose NAME does not start with the given prefix
List tunnels that are active at the given TIME in RFC3339 format (default: current time, 2022-11-18T23:26:19-05:00)
List tunnel by ID
Include connections that have recently disconnected in the list (default: false)
Sorts the list of tunnels by the given field. Valid options are {name, id, createdAt, deletedAt, numConnections} (default: "name") [$TUNNEL_LIST_SORT_BY]
Inverts the sort order of the tunnel list. (default: false) [$TUNNEL_LIST_INVERT_SORT]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.description: List details about the active connectors for a tunnel

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.

Autoupdate frequency. Default is 24h0m0s. (default: 24h0m0s)

Listen address for metrics reporting. (default: "localhost:") [$TUNNEL_METRICS]
Write the application's PID to this file after first successful connection. [$TUNNEL_PIDFILE]

Save application log to this file for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGFILE]
Save application log to this directory for reporting issues. [$TUNNEL_LOGDIRECTORY]
Name of trace output file, generated when cloudflared stops. [$TUNNEL_TRACE_OUTPUT]
Render output using given FORMAT. Valid options are 'json' or 'yaml'
Include connections that have recently disconnected in the list (default: false)
Sorts the list of connections of a tunnel by the given field. Valid options are {id, startedAt, numConnections, version} (default: "createdAt") [$TUNNEL_INFO_SORT_BY]
Inverts the sort order of the tunnel info. (default: false) [$TUNNEL_INFO_INVERT_SORT]
show help (default: false)

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete existing tunnel by UUID or name
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel [tunnel command options] delete [subcommand options] TUNNEL

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.

subcommands.description: Cleanup tunnel connections

options.description: Specifies a config file in YAML format.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Shows a list of commands or help for one command
subcommands.usage: cloudflared tunnel help [command options] [command]

options.description: show help (default: false)

tldr:
> Command-line tool to create a persistent connection to the Cloudflare network.
> More information: <https://developers.cloudflare.com/argo-tunnel/>.

- Authenticate and associate the connection to a domain in the Cloudflare account:

`cloudflared tunnel login`

- Establish a tunnel to a host in Cloudflare from the local server:

`cloudflared tunnel --hostname {{hostname}} localhost:{{port_number}}`

- Establish a tunnel to a host in Cloudflare from the local server, without verifying the local server's certificate:

`cloudflared tunnel --hostname {{hostname}} localhost:{{port_number}} --no-tls-verify`

- Save logs to a file:

`cloudflared tunnel --hostname {{hostname}} http://localhost:{{port_number}} --loglevel {{panic|fatal|error|warn|info|debug}} --logfile {{path/to/file}}`

- Install cloudflared as a system service:

`cloudflared service install`
